change.changenote: Section 5 (3) BEFORE amended by 2016-5-42,Sch 4, effective March 10, 2016 (Royal Assent)

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: Every party to a contract to which this Act applies is relieved from fulfilling obligations under the contract that were required to be performed before the frustration or avoidance but were not performed, except in so far as some other party to the contract has become entitled to damages for consequential loss as a result of the failure to fulfil those obligations.

change.changenote: Section 7 (1) BEFORE amended by 2017-10-60,Sch 1, effective November 2, 2017 (Royal Assent).

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: If restitution is claimed for the performance or part performance of an obligation under the contract, other than an obligation to pay money, in so far as the claim is based on expenditures incurred in performing the contract, the amount recoverable must include only reasonable expenditures.
